name: Heat Metal
effect: A piece of metal such as a weapon or suit of armor becomes unbearably hot. If the item is worn or carried, the wearer takes 2 {{damage.heat}} damage, which increases by 2 each turn to a maximum of 8 {{damage.heat}} damage per turn.

name: Mend
effect: The caster magically repairs a small wound, crack, or tear in a person or object. The target must be smaller than one cubic foot of volume.

name: Clay Armor
effect: The caster's skin becomes hardened clay for one hour, improving BC by 5.

name: Quake
effect: The caster concentrates on accumulating seismic forces within the earth. A patch of ground with a radius of 10 feet begins to tremble and undulate noticeably. When the spell is ended, all targets within 30 feet of the caster take 1d10 {{damage.force}} damage for every turn concentration was maintained.

name: Quicksand
effect: Transform solid ground into sinking sand. The affected area becomes difficult terrain. Additionally, targets which start their turn on the quicksand must make a DT 14 {{skills.mobility}} saving throw or lose the ability to move.

name: Acid Blade
effect: Imbue a blade you touch with the power of acid. For one hour, attacks with the weapon deal 1d4 {{damage.acid}} damage and decrease enemy BC by 1.

name: Clay Golem
effect: A clay golem is summoned for 8 hours. Though the weakest of the golems, it has resistance to {{damage.bludgeoning}} and {{damage.piercing}} damage due to its soft body.

name: Stone Armor
effect: The caster's skin becomes brittle stone, improving BC by 7. The armor shatters after 10 {{damage.bludgeoning}} damage is taken, ending the spell.

name: Earthen Wall
effect: A great earthen wall up to 100 feet long appears in the indicated location, obstructing movement. The wall can absorb 50 damage before it breaks, and is immune to {{damage.heat}} damage. Targets over the area where the wall was constructed are pushed aside.

name: Stone Golem
effect: Summon a stone golem. The golem is vulnerable to {{damage.bludgeoning}} damage, but resistant to {{damage.piercing}} damage.

name: Iron Armor
effect: Your skin becomes covered by a magical metallic liquid. The liquid condenses and becomes firm wherever an arrow, missile, or blade would strike true. {{BC}} is increased by 10.

name: Awaken Statue
effect: A statue you touch comes to life for one hour. The statue may assist you in battle or inform you events that have transpired since it was built.

name: Earthquake
effect: The ground around you rumbles and shakes, as your spell unleashes a mighty earthquake. Creatures within 300 yards take 3d12 {{damage.force} damage and have disadvantage on the saving throw to avoid being knocked prone.

name: Iron Golem
effect: Summon a heavy iron golem, heaviest of the golems.

name: Petrify
effect: Transform a creature of living flesh into stone. The creature may make a DT 10 {{skills.defense}} saving throw to resist this effect.
